summary: "Dream of the Red Chamber" is an 18th-century Chinese novel by Cao Xueqin, one of the greatest in Chinese literature. It explores the rise and fall of a powerful family, reflecting the decline of the Qing dynasty. The story focuses on family dynamics, especially the power of the father, but also pays tribute to the women in Cao's life. It's known for its complex plot and insights into Chinese culture and philosophy. Cao wrote it over several years, and after his death, others added extra chapters, creating different versions. The novel is so important that there's an entire field of study dedicated to it, called Redology.
title: Dream of the Red Chamber
